events.title: Android 101
events.abstract:
Here you can gain knowledge of the basic concepts of Android development.
Starting off with the setup, taking you along the "Hello World" lane down to views and user interaction land to the library district.
This session aims at people with knowledge of coding but no or little knowledge of Android.

events.title: Introduction to Google AppEngine with Python
events.abstract: A basic introduction to Google's PaaS "AppEngine", the architecture of an application and best practices.

events.title: ProfitBricks Tech & APIs
events.abstract: tba

events.title: V Hack Android start session
events.abstract: Dirk and Richard will give a short introduction on how the V Hack Android Hackathon is organized.

events.title: GWT and the Future
events.abstract:
GWT - no speed limits for web development
GWT is one of the great web frameworks and has had a tremendous effect since it started in 2006. Writing efficient Javascript apps with GWT has never been easier since the GWT 2.5 release offers so many new great things like Elementals, Super Dev Mode, massive compiler improvements and UiBinder Templates. 
This session will take you through a journey of GWT past, present and future and will also shed some light on the future development process of GWT and the latest releases.
Using a compiler to write Javascript apps seems unusual at first, but it offers an amazing source of performance gain. This talk will show many of the GWT Compiler tricks that make GWT apps so fast.

events.title: Automatic tests and builds for Android
events.abstract: Automatic tests and builds for Android

events.title: Introduction to Google TV
events.abstract: This talk will cover everything you need to know to get started with GoogleTV, whether that's developing a web app for Chrome or developing a native Android application.

events.title: Google+ REST API
events.abstract: How to read public data from Google+ and use it in interesting ways.

events.title: Google+ History API
events.abstract: How to write "moments" to your own private Google+ history, using this fairly new member of the Google+ API family.

events.title: Scala on Android
events.abstract: Scala is a modern multi-paradigm language on top of the JVM which has been getting a lot of traction recently. It mostly gets used on the back-end but with a few tricks you can also write Android apps in it. This talk will explain why Scala is worth exploring and how you can use it to develop apps on Android.

events.title: Phonegap - Nativ und Web zugleich
events.abstract:
PhoneGap - native and web at the same time
Who has not been part of a debate native vs. web when it comes to app development? Depending on which way you choose you have to live with the disadvantages. Wouldn’t it be cool if you could write a native apps and a webapp at the same time?
With PhoneGap you can use web technologies to write your app in a platform independent way, while being able to use any native feature that you need. This can be done by using the PhoneGap API or by writing so called PhoneGap Plugins. This session will introduce you to PhoneGap and its development flow and will teach you how to write PhoneGap plugins yourself.

events.title: Creating Modern Android UIs
events.abstract: Present best practices for user interface design for Android and introduce some open source building blocks that you can use to create a modern Android UI.

events.title: m-GWT
events.abstract:
mgwt - GWT goes mobile
Building mobile apps and webpages with mgwt & gwt-phonegap is a great way to build cross platform mobile apps in Java. Especially porting your existing GWT apps becomes incredibly easy.
With Phonegap you can build cross platform apps based on web standards. This can be done with Javascript. GWT on the other hand is an excellent tool for building fast Javascript apps in Java, but it is missing some key parts for building great mobile apps with it. The two open source projects mgwt and gwt-phonegap close this gap: mgwt provides mobile widgets, that look like native widgets for different platforms - gwt-phonegap enables GWT apps to use Phonegap.  --- Putting these frameworks to work creates performant mobile apps that feel like native apps while being platform independent.

events.title: Croutons for Android
events.abstract: Croutons are context sensitive notifications for Android. Unlike the Toast class they know where they belong. They are provided as an Open Source library that can be used within any Android project. The talk will be an introduction into the library as well as a Demo that aims to show practical usage of Croutons.

events.title: Google Places API Developer Challenge Live Hangout
events.abstract: Introduction to Google Places API Challenge. Paul will attend via Hangout and give you all the info you need for the Google Places API Challenge Hackathon.

events.title: GWT for Frontend Developers
events.abstract:
The session focuses on the experiences Peter and his colleagues gathered at a two and a half years GWT project for the VZ Netzwerke. The task was a redesign and complete technology shift, aiming to support several million users on three platforms with one GWT codebase. 
Peter will present you the view of a HTML/CSS guy on this project. You won't see much JAVA code, but get a peek on the workflow and insights he and his colleagues figured out.

events.title: A practical introduction to Go
events.abstract: This talk shows the strengths of Go through a practical example, explains why programming languages like Go become more important in the world of modern computing and demonstrates how C and C++ programmers can already profit from using Go.

events.title: Google+ Hangouts API
events.abstract: Google+ Hangouts API - How to write web apps that make use of the real-time collaboration and communication features of Google+ Hangouts.

events.title: Economic development programs and opportunities in Berlin, Germany, and the EU
events.abstract: The TSB Innovation agency supports Berlin-based freelancers, startups and small up to medium enterprises to bring their R&D efforts into the market. In the talk we give an idea, how the TSB works , and we summarize some economic development programs and opportunities.

events.title: Identify yourself with PayPal Access!
events.abstract: This talk is going to present the use cases & implementation overview of PayPal Access. It's a technology which is based on OAuth 2 or OpenID and enables users to use their existing PayPal credentials to login at different other sites.

events.title: Android development in a new Light
events.abstract: Derrick will be talking about how android developers need to look at past achievements in technology and challenge what resulted from them. "It is not enough to build upon the building blocks of technology, One must also reshape and rebuild those building blocks."

events.title: PlayN
events.abstract: tba

events.title: BarCamp start
events.abstract: Organize your own BarCamp sessions & workshops here. There are two rooms and five 30 minute slots available. We'll start to collect ideas for the BarCamp and for workshops on Saturday. Have your 2 minute pitch prepared for this starter session!

events.tags: Hackathon, Android, Google Maps, Google Places, GPAC, finale
events.title: Hackathon finale
events.abstract: The grand finale. Fun, catastrophes, sweat, coolness, worlds breaking down and Lift Offs to spaces where {placeholder} are included. We'll have prices, mate, cold beer, cool drinks, coffee and hacks. If you feel that something is missing, bring it. Be prepared to judge and vote!
